Body__c:
This article introduces the new features, enhancements, and fixes available with this release.

For fixes, nCino administrators can click the Product Development Issue (PDI) link to see the Known Issues entry for the PDI. Known Issue details can help you determine if the issue affects your financial institution (FI) and help you plan release testing, if necessary. Your FI's Community Administrator controls access to the Known Issues page.

  • For the latest Portfolio Analytics releases, see "Portfolio Analytics Release Notes Hub."

  • For the latest integrations releases, see "Integrations: Monthly Release Notes 2025."

  • All Lines of Business

All Lines of Business

Accessibility—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancement: nCino remains dedicated to the delivery of accessibility enhancements in accordance with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, Level AA standards.

Our Accessibility and Design teams made user interface enhancements to features to continue our WCAG compliance journey for this release. The feature updated for this release is Customer Portal.

For more information, see “Accessibility Release Notes.” For quick links to relevant documentation, see “Welcome to the Accessibility Documentation Experience.”

Collateral Management—Global

Applies to: All

Fixes:

  • The nCino PDE - Record Trigger: Collateral Mgmt Before Save flow now populates the correct Record Type for those collaterals. (PDI-18199)

  • When administrators configure the LLC_BI__UI_Collateral_Summary field set with fields from related objects, the Collateral Summary section loads correctly. (PDI-18295)

Document Manager—Global

Applies to: All

Important: nCino does not recommend that you use this version of the Placeholder Template Consolidation tool due to a known issue in which the system sets inactive placeholders to “Waived” status in Document Manager. The 2025_05 release will include a fix for this issue.

New Feature: nCino introduces the Placeholder Template Consolidation tool to identify and correct duplicate and misconfigured placeholder templates in the Document Manager Admin tool. 

Administrators can use the consolidation tool to:

  • Identify existing placeholder templates that are duplicated or that have other misconfiguration issues. 

  • Download a CSV file report of all placeholder templates with misconfiguration issues. 

  • Consolidate duplicate placeholder templates. 

Note: Financial institutions (FIs) must ensure they do not have duplicate placeholder templates prior to adopting Priority Manager. Using the consolidation tool to consolidate duplicate placeholder templates is required for FIs that have used Document Manager and are upgrading to Priority Manager.

For more information, see “How to Configure Document Manager Placeholders.”

Enhancement: When users duplicate placeholders in Document Manager, the system integrates with Smart Checklist and Priority Manager to create a linked requirement. For more information, see “How to Configure Document Manager Placeholders.”

Fix: The File Staging area in Document Manager now displays all uploaded files in a clear and accessible manner, allowing users to preview and download the files without any visual distortion. (PDI-18646)

Document Manager - Locate and File—US and APAC

Applies to: All

New Feature: Document Manager - Locate and File is the latest AI capability for the nCino Platform that streamlines document management. Users can upload documents to File Staging, where the system automatically identifies the correct relationship or loan placeholder and organizes files accordingly. This capability eliminates the need for manual sorting or searching, and ensures a more efficient and organized process.

With this new capability, users can:

  • Match up to 15 files simultaneously with placeholders across multiple loans and relationships.

  • Automate the creation of placeholders when they upload multiple years of tax returns.

  • Support all US English-language documents.

Note: This version of Document Manager - Locate and File does not support the Collateral Document Manager view, Households, and Salesforce Person Accounts.

Users can access this capability from Relationship Document Manager File Staging. For more information about this new AI capability, refer to "How to Configure Document Manager - Locate and File" and "How to Use Document Manager - Locate and File."

Fee Management—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancements:

The latest version of Fee Management introduces significant UI enhancements to streamline the fee configuration process across multiple workflows. The enhanced UI makes fee selection more intuitive, review processes more organized, and bulk operations more efficient, to provide users with greater control and clarity when they manage fees.

Admins must enable the new Enhanced Fee Management LWC UI feature process to view all the enhancements. For more information, see “How to Configure Fee Management.”

Add Fees Dialog Box 

  • The enhanced Add Fees dialog box now has improved sorting and filtering capabilities for fee selection. To sort any column in the fee table, users can now click column headers and toggle between ascending and descending order.

  • A new drop-down menu allows users to switch between Suggested Fees (fees associated with the current product) and All Fees (org-wide fee types).

  • To simplify the fee addition workflow, the UI no longer displays the Add Non-Standard Fee button and users can now access non-standard fees directly through the All Fees view in the list builder component. The Apply Selected Fees button now appears as Next to better reflect the workflow progression.

  • To help users identify recommended options, fee types suggested through Fee Management are now have a Suggested badge in their accordion headers.

Add Fees: Edit and Save Dialog Box 

  • The enhanced Review Fees dialog box now has a structured layout with three rows of essential fields: Calculation Type with Amount/Percentage options, Collection Method with Fee Paid By selections, and Add to APR/EIR options.

  • The dialog box now organizes fees by type within expandable accordion sections, which are expanded by default for better visibility.

  • The system now supports custom field sets that administrators can configure via Screen Section settings, which allows them to add custom fields below the standard ones.

  • For improved clarity, the Save button at the end of the dialog box now appears as Add Fees to better reflect its function.

Bulk Updates 

The enhanced Fee Management UI now offers simplified bulk operations, which allows users to select and update or remove multiple fees at once through a dedicated Bulk Update button in the Fee Summary table. Users can modify specific fields during a bulk update, and all fields are editable when updating a single fee.

For more information about the enhancements, see “How to Use Fee Management for Commercial, Retail, and Small Business Loans.”

Fixes:

  • The enhanced UI experience now enables users to sort columns in an ascending or descending order. (PDI-17052)

  • The enhanced UI experience now enables users to view the name, type, and other details of each fee within the Add Fee dialog box. (PDI-17381)

  • The system now correctly displays the fees associated with each loan when users navigate between loans. (PDI-18058)

  • The system now allows users to translate the Suggested field name in the Add Fee dialog box. (PDI-17067)

  • In the Review Fees dialog box, the Status field now correctly defaults to Active for fees on loans and Inactive for fees on pricing options. (PDI-16924)

Priority Manager—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancement: Users can now manually create an ad hoc placeholder in Document Manager, and the system generates a requirement on the placeholder based on the linked Requirement Template. Users can view this requirement in Priority Manager and Smart Checklist.

Fix: Users can now filter very large lists (over 50K requirements) in Priority Manager based on Loan fields. (PDI-17975)

Smart Checklist—Global

Applies to: All

Enhancements: Users can now manually create an ad hoc placeholder in Document Manager, and the system generates a requirement on the placeholder based on the linked Requirement Template. Users can view this requirement in Priority Manager and Smart Checklist.

Commercial Banking

Automated Spreading—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Fixes:

  • Users no longer encounter an error message when they attempt to auto-spread a new document. (PDI-18622) 

    Note: This fix is an instantly deployed AWS fix, therefore no package upgrade is required.

  • When users attempt drop-down actions in the mapping grid, Automated Spreading responds as expected. (PDI-18616)

Conditions—Global

(2025_03_01) 

Applies to: Commercial

Fix: Adverse Actions no longer errors when Conditions are on a Product Package and associated to a loan but there are no requirements on the loan. (PDI-18840)

Covenant Management & Servicing—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Enhancement: Covenant Management & Servicing allows administrators to configure default values for Grace Days on the combination of Covenant Type and Frequency. Administrators can set a Covenant Mgmt record as a template via the new Is Template checkbox. This allows them to use the template record to automatically populate Grace Days. Records that they set as templates cannot be set to Active. 

The Covenant Servicing Upgrade tool user interface now allows administrators to populate Grace Days and map them to Frequency templates. 

For more information, see “How to Configure Covenant Management & Servicing: Required Configuration.” 

Fixes:

  • Users can now run the Create Default Field Maps feature process more than one time and the system does not create duplicate field maps. (PDI-18420)

  • When users manually deactivate a covenant associated to a booked loan, it remains inactive permanently, even if automation to active/deactivate a covenant is on. (PDI-18401)

  • On Relationship, the Covenant Details panel Compliance Details section now sorts Covenant Compliances by Due Date with the most current Due Date listed first. (PDI-18103)

Credit Memo—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Information Updates:  

  • In response to (PDI-8859), administrators who conditionally render section headers must add the same conditional rendering to those section titles in the table of contents.

  • Credit memo template source code now contain a <!DOCTYPE html> tag in the first line. Do not modify this tag, the system now requires it to generate the credit memo.

 For more information, refer to “How to Configure Credit Memo.”

Deal Proposal—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Information Update: When a user creates a new deal via Defer to New Deal on the Remove Loan dialog box, the new product package inherits the record type ID from the deferred loan’s previous product package.

For more information, refer to "How to Configure Deal Proposal - Required Configuration."

Environment, Social, and Governance—Global

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Enhancements:

  • nCino now supports cloning when the approval process locks and unlocks a record.

    • Administrators can enable a setting to use this functionality. See the Enable Record Locking and Unlocking section in "How to Configure ESG."

    • The Is_Locked__c field label has changed to “Is Cloned.”

  • The transformation scoring flow now directs the flow to the corresponding assessment subflow to support different scoring logic across assessment levels. The new transformation flows are:

    • ESG - Collateral Assessment Transformation Scoring Flow

    • ESG - Customer Assessment Transformation Scoring Flow

    • ESG - Loan Assessment Transformation Scoring Flow

For more information, see "How to Configure ESG" and "How to Configure ESG (Optional)."

Loan Team—Global

Applies to: Commercial

Fix: The Approval Process now sends approval and rejection emails to Loan Team Members and Loan Officers without the creation of new contact records or duplicate records. (PDI-18388)

Participate (US)—US

(2025_03_01) 

Applies to: Commercial

New Feature: The Participate (US) integration enables FIs to sell loans and manage post-sale activities through Participate, a digital loan marketplace. nCino transmits loan data to Participate, which reduces duplicative data entry and increases the FI's ability to post loans for sale.

This integration currently provides:

  • a route within the nCino loan workflow where your FI can prepare and transmit the necessary data to Participate.

  • access to Participate, where you can sell loans and manage post-sale activities.

  • automatic route installation for existing US-based Syndications & Participations users.

Note: This new feature is only applicable with the 2025_03_01 release, the release deployed with the Standard Release Deployment (SRD) schedule.

For more information, refer to:

  • Participate (US) Getting Started Guide 

  • Participate (US) Installation Guide 

  • Participate (US) User Guide 

Syndications & Participations—US

(2025_03_01) 

Applies to: Commercial

Enhancement: US-based FIs who use Syndications & Participations automatically receive a subroute (landing page) to the new feature, Participate (US), an integration to sell loans and manage post-sale activities. This new subroute is for informational purposes only. No functionality changes until you configure the feature. To disable the subroute, see How to Configure Syndications & Participations.

Note: This enhancement is only applicable with the 2025_03_01 release, the release deployed with the Standard Release Deployment (SRD) schedule.

For more information, refer to How to Configure Syndications & Participations and How to Use Syndications & Participations.

Consumer Banking

Credit Underwriting—US

Applies to: Consumer Banking

New Feature: The Credit Underwriting feature for Consumer Lending manages pricing, decisioning, and underwriting through the AWS API suite. Credit Underwriting is available to new customers. For existing customers who want to upgrade to the new Credit Underwriting experience from their current experience, contact your nCino representative.

Customer Engagement—Global

Applies to: Consumer Banking

Fixes:

  • To comply with accessibility best practices, the loading spinners on the Customer Portal dashboard now have alt text and the decorative cloud icon is now compliant. (PDI-18460)

  • In Online Application, screen readers now read all options for lookup fields. (PDI-16158)

  • Previously, when a user attempted to log into Customer Portal with an incorrect username or password, the system produced an error message that did not meet accessibility criteria. The error message is now readable by screen readers. (PDI-15987)

Retail Loan Origination System—Global

Applies to: Consumer Banking

Fix: Previously, when a user attempted to convert a Retail Loan, and an FI had a Record Type Name (DeveloperName) of “Retail_Loan” on an object that was not the Loan object, the system did not create the Loan intermittently. This error no longer occurs. (PDI-18431) 

Mortgage UK

Mortgage UK—UK

Applies to: Mortgage UK

Enhancements:

  • On the New Mortgage dialog box, a new MORUK__NewMortgageModal__c field set now captures additional information before mortgage loan creation.

  • Product Selection now supports Lifetime Tracker products. These products use LLC_BI__Reversion_Rate__c for the rate because LLC_BI__Fixed_Period__c is no longer required and can be blank or 0.

  • The system updates the LLC_BI__Status__c field and sets the associated fees to active. Product fees are now inactive by default. Minor configuration is required.

For more information, see “How to Use Mortgage (UK)” and "How to Configure Mortgage (UK)".

Small Business Banking

Dodd-Frank 1071—US

Applies to: Commercial

Enhancement: To adhere to Dodd-Frank 1071 regulations, nCino made a required update to Customer Portal so FIs can invite applicants to fill out the business and principal owner demographic information.

For more information, see “Get Started with Dodd-Frank 1071.”

SBA Data Guide—US

Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

Enhancement: Household Relationship records no longer appear in the SBA Data Guide, the SBA Form 1919, or in the E-Tran Review Screen.

Fix: The system now sends the PrincipalRace code only one time when the principal connection is with both the eligible passive company (EPC) and the operating company (OC), and no longer gives a validation error during submission. (Not linked to PDI)

Support Service Offerings

nCino provides Support Service Offerings (SSO) to help you take advantage of the latest functionality.

To learn more, see Support Services Offerings.

Early Adopter Features

nCino's Early Adopter (EA) program grants select customers advanced access to new and enhanced features. For more information about EA features, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM).

Now available to customers in the EA program:

Continuous Credit Monitoring:

nCino Continuous Credit Monitoring, embedded in the nCino Platform, provides real-time, data-driven insights and recommended actions for proactive risk monitoring across the credit lifecycle, while leveraging automation and augmentation to streamline risk management.

Release Resources

Use the following documentation to successfully adopt the latest release:

  • Feature Deprecations

  • Accessibility Release Notes

  • GA Installation Guide

  • Metadata Changes

  • Permission Changes

Feature Availability Columns Explained

Notes:

  • Blank rows indicate that what is new is a fix; feature availability information does not apply to fixes.

  • The following tables are grouped by line of business; however, many features apply to several lines of business.

Controlled by Feature Management? 

  • "Yes" indicates that there is a feature toggle or feature process that controls what's new. Configuration may still be required to fully enable.

  • "Available with Feature" indicates that what is new is available if the parent feature is enabled or if the feature process runs automatically. Configuration may still be required to fully enable.

  • "No" indicates that what is new is not controlled by a feature toggle or process. Configuration may still be required to enable.

On package installation, is it visible or impactful to current end users of the feature? 

  • "Yes" indicates that current end users (of this feature) will experience new functionality immediately after release installation (without configuration).

  • "No" indicates that current end users (of this feature) do not experience any new functionality after release installation.

Configuration Level of Effort 

Provides an estimate of the configuration effort for what's new. For example, the Configuration Level of Effort for an enhancement means the level of effort to configure the enhancement if the FI already has the parent feature (unless otherwise specified).

Options include:

  • No config

  • Minor config

    Note: Minor config means that an FI administrator can perform this configuration; however, you can choose to request assistance via Support Service Offering: Configuration Assistance.

  • SSO (Support Servicing Offering) recommended

  • Project recommended

  • API Implementation

    Note: This functionality requires API implementation by developer resources and is outside the scope of nCino Support. Contact your CSM to engage nCino Professional Services.

Multi-currency & Multilingual support? 

  • "MC" indicates that this feature supports multiple currencies.

  • "ML" indicates that this feature supports multiple languages.
Title: 2025_03 Product Release Notes
Summary: This article introduces new features, enhancements, and fixes available with the nCino Platform. It includes a Feature Availability table for new features and enhancements.
